issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: storm-core
components.description: Core storm daemons and APIs including trident

comments.body:
The exception in the description is misleading, and happens on every test run. It's not the cause of the failure.

The failure is because the test asserts that when Nimbus tries to clean up "topo2" and "topo3", it calls first IStormClusterState.teardownHeartbeats("topo2"), then IStormClusterState.teardownHeartbeats("topo3"). Nimbus iterates over a Set of topo ids, so the order is nondeterministic. We should just replace the mocking/verification with Mockito, so we can assert that the calls happen without asserting the order they happen in.

worklogs.comment:
GitHub user srdo opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/2749

    STORM-3137: Fix too strict mock verification in nimbus_test

    https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/STORM-3137

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/srdo/storm STORM-3137

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/2749.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #2749
    
----
commit f964f3fb555b34c5328046ee3044b443d0f191ec
Author: Stig Rohde DÃ¸ssing <srdo@...>
Date:   2018-06-30T09:06:29Z

    STORM-3137: Fix too strict mock verification in nimbus_test

----

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

    https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/2749
